Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the deployment of troops to Iraq by implying that they are being sent for combat, when in fact they are being deployed to facilitate the evacuation of overseas Filipino workers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that troops are being deployed for combat. The evidence provided indicates that the deployment is for the purpose of facilitating the evacuation of Filipino workers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deployment of troops to Iraq is for combat, without considering alternative explanations or the official statements made by Defense Secretary Lorenzana ruling out combat engagement.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the troops are being deployed to facilitate the evacuation of overseas Filipino workers in Iraq, as stated by Defense Secretary Lorenzana and reported by multiple local media outlets.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not explicitly specifying the purpose of the troop deployment and by relying on misleading comments from Facebook users to support the assumption of combat engagement.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any aspect of the situation.
